title: BBC Local Live: Devon and Cornwall on Friday 5 January 2018 - BBC News
summary: storm-hit sea wall repairs begin in portreath .
timber spill heading for devon beaches .
'quick and sharp ' flooding in plymouth on thursday evening .
huge gap in undiagnosed dementia patients .
dozens of farmers urge ministers to back nature-friendly agriculture .

documents.title: newcastle 28-20 exeter
text: newcastle 28-20 exeter

documents.title: exeter city 0-2 west bromwich albion
text: exeter city 0-2 west bromwich albion
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport at St James Park

documents.title: wrexham 4-0 torquay united
text: wrexham 4-0 torquay united

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for devon and cornwall have finished for the day , but we 'll be back at 07:00 on monday with the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
do n't forget spotlight on bbc one later .
there will also be news through the night on your bbc local radio station .
get the latest news for your area from the bbc .

documents.title: jail for ex-teacher who assaulted pupils
text: jail for ex-teacher who assaulted pupils

documents.title: portreath sea wall repair work making 'good progress '
text: the contractors repairing the damaged sea wall at portreath say they 're making `` good progress '' .
cormac started working on the wall after storm eleanor blasted a 65ft ( 20m ) hole in it on wednesday .
people are being urged to stay clear of the wall until the work is completed .
we 'll be back in the morning at # portreath to continue repairs to the harbour wall caused earlier this week by storm eleanor .
we 're making good progress , but please stay clear until the work is completed .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: weather update : colder and windy this weekend
text: there will be further showers overnight with some potential hail and thunder in places .
it will be occasionally breezy and colder than of late with the chance of frost in some rural spots , or icy patches where showers have been .
saturday will remain cloudy across the region with further showery rain at times .
it will be cold with an added wind chill from a brisk easterly wind .
maximum temperature : 6c ( 43f ) .
author: David Braine
Weather Forecaster

documents.title: cornwall travel : horses loose on the road in connor downs
text: in connor downs , there are reports of loose horses on trenawin lane near gwinear road .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: cornwall travel : road closed due to accident
text: in long rock , the a30 longrock bypass westbound is closed due to an accident between the a394 and the a30 eastern green .
it 's affecting traffic heading towards penzance .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: police say criminal gangs are 'national issue , local problem '
text: devon & cornwall police have released a poster explaining how to spot the work of criminal gangs in the local area .
titled `` county lines : national issue , local problem '' , the poster follows a number of incidents across the south west involving gangs who relocate to the area to sell drugs .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: albion 's game called off due to 'waterlogged pitch '
text: saturday 's plymouth albion game against bishop 's stortford has been called off due to a `` waterlogged pitch '' , the club has said .
it will be re-arranged for later in the season .
we 're sorry to announce that tomorrow 's @ twitterid game v @ twitterid has been called off due to a waterlogged pitch .
it will be re-arranged later in the season .
@ twitterid # nat1
i assume tickets already bought for tomorrow will be valid for the rescheduled game ?
yes nick , we 'll make a full announcement when the re-arranged date is confirmed
such a shame chaps !
do n't blame you though - feels like it has n't stopped raining .
hope the pitch gets back to its best soon .
thanks guys !
gutted but thanks for letting us know # albialbialbi
hi i pre bought tickets on line will they email new ones for the re arranged game ?
gutted , and the weather looked good for tomorrow too .
it 's going to be a very busy run in to the end of the season .
what a shame but have to protect the players
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornwall travel : a30 accident and flooding in st stephens
text: cornwall travel : a30 accident and flooding in st stephens
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: rock-smash seal among storm casualties
text: rock-smash seal among storm casualties

documents.title: devon travel : queues building on a38 after crash
text: # devon on the # a38 eastbound towards # saltash , within the junction of the # b4314 near to # higherstbudeaux , one lane closed due to a collision .
queues building .
allow extra journey time .
@ twitterid
author: Twitter

documents.title: view from newspapers for dorset , devon and somerset close
text: the view from newspapers for dorset , devon and somerset have closed .
on its facebook page , the firm said it had been forced to shut `` with immediate effect '' due to `` the continued difficult trading climate '' .
facebook user jilly parry said she would miss the newspapers `` immensely '' .
nicola james said : `` such a shame , it was a great way to keep up to date with local news . ''

documents.title: breaking19-year-old man is second to die in a39 crash
text: a second man has died after a crash on the a39 , police have said .
officers were called to reports of a vauxhall corsa on its roof on the a39 truro to falmouth road , just before the norway inn , at about midnight on 18 december .
the 18-year-old driver from roche was declared deceased at the scene .
it has now emerged that the passenger , a 19-year-old man from bulge who was immediately taken to hospital , has since died , devon and cornwall police have said .
officers from the serious collisions unit are appealing for witnesses and anyone with any information is asked to contact the police via 101 .

documents.title: coastpath is 'dangerous and still moving '
text: part of a footpath that collapsed this morning between porthleven and loe bar is `` quite dramatic , dangerous and still moving '' according to the national trust .
the path has been closed , although mike hardy , the national trust 's lead ranger at the penrose estate said he does n't expect anymore of the path to fall away at that spot .
`` you ca n't fix things like this .
you ca n't patch it .
`` it 's about adaptation and looking at the future , realising the coast is very dynamic and by always knowing we are going to need to migrate back .
`` we are working with natural processes rather than trying to patch it up and repair it , because you just ca n't do it . ''
a new temporary diversion has been put in place using an existing bridleway , and engineers from cormac have been to the site .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: drivers warned to 'take extra care ' as temperatures drop
text: south western ambulance service nhs foundation trust ( swasft ) has warned drivers to `` take extra care '' on the roads this weekend as the colder weather arrives .
a yellow severe weather warning for ice has been issued by the met office .
swasft added that drivers should `` never assume a road has been gritted '' .
really cold weather across the south west this weekend which could bring hazardous driving conditions .
please take extra care on the roads and never assume a road has been gritted # roadsafety
author: Hayley Westcott
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornwall travel : reports of accident in charlestown
text: there are reports of an accident on charlestown road near quay road .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon farm raiders ordered to pay back almost £ 150,000
text: a gang of farm raiders who stole dozens of vehicles from rural communities across devon have been ordered to pay back almost £ 150,000 .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: coastpath is 'very , very , very dangerous '
text: a damaged footpath along a dramatic section of cornish clifftop coastpath has been described as very dangerous by a walker who has seen it .
rob lawrance was walking along the path at lunchtime .
he 's told bbc radio cornwall :
`` you can see the footpath is undercut by about 4ft and it 's just the shape of the wave underneath it .
`` there 's a crack near the bricks and the wall that 's coming back about 10 or 20ft .
`` it 's very , very , very dangerous . ''
the national trust has closed the path and is asking people to keep away .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: timber : 'not a case of finders keepers '
text: the maritime and coastguard agency ( mca ) is reminding people of the rules surround salvage material after it emerged tonnes of wood planks are heading for north devon 's beaches .
alison kentuck , receiver of wreck for the maritime & coastguard agency , said : `` the timber will not be suitable for use as a building material as it 's been saturated with salt water .
`` our biggest concern is to make sure that members of the public do n't put themselves at risk attempting to retrieve any timber , especially given the current weather conditions .
`` it is not a case of finders keepers , the mca is continuing to work alongside the ship 's agents and the local authority . ''
under the merchant shipping act 1995 , all recoveries of wreck material ( which covers any timber lost from a vessel at sea ) must be reported to the receiver of wreck .
failing to report removal of wreck to the receiver is a criminal offence .
timber from a spill at sea will be washing up on # ndevon beaches , please take care

documents.title: police widen search for missing devon man
text: police are widening their search for missing ivybridge man daniel dawes , who was last seen on 29 december .
devon and somerset fire and rescue service and the police dog team are joining the effort to search the surrounding dartmoor area on saturday .
daniel has previously been found on dartmoor and in rural isolated locations , and is believed to be on foot .
any information on daniel 's whereabouts should be reported to the police on 101 .
author: Sarah Gosling
BBC News Online

documents.title: ice warning for devon and cornwall
text: between 23:00 friday and 08:00 saturday : icy patches are expected to develop during the evening and overnight , most likely on untreated roads , pavements and cycle paths .
there is a chance that injuries could occur from slips and falls on icy surfaces .
a yellow severe weather warning for # ice has been issued : stay # weatheraware @ twitterid

documents.title: people told to keep away from coastpath
text: the coastpath between porthleven and loe bar has been closed after a cliff fall .
these show how the side of the path has fallen away , and the national trust is telling people to keep away .
the area has been hit by heavy storms in recent days .
thanks to rob lawrance for the - he assures us he was at a safe distance when he took them .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: four more south west swimmers for england
text: former paralympic champion jonathan fox heads a list of four south west swimmers who have been added to the england squad for this year 's commonwealth games .
the 26-year-old from cornwall , who won paralympic gold at london 2012 , is set to compete at his first commonwealth games .
also set to make their commonwealth debuts are plymouth leander trio tom fannon , laura stephens and jessica jackson .
they join leander 's reigning double-gold medalist from 2014 and current world 50m butterfly champion ben proud , who was selected for the squad back in october .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: england trio challenge you to sign up ! # fapeoplescup
text: consider yourself a great five-a-side footballer or willing to give it a go ?
fancy something fun to get 2018 off to a great start ?
want a chance to play at st george 's park and go to the fa cup final ?
sign up is now available for the fa people 's cup - the free five-a-side competition that 's back and even bigger than before .
do n't take our word for it , listen to these three
find out all the details about the competition here - and you 'll be able to see jesse lingard , jack butland and harry maguire try our five-a-side challenge on the bbc sport website on saturday .

documents.title: computer programme could help those with dementia
text: a new computer programme can help dementia patients get faster treatment , it is hoped .
it is thought around 50,000 people in the south west have the condition , and due to the numbers , diagnosis can take a long time for those referred by their doctors .
dr laura hill , associate clinical director with the devon memory service explained how the new system may help .

she said : `` if they do have dementia they are going to access their assessments in a prompt fashion and therefore they can get onto treatment and get the support that they need so that they can live alongside their diagnosis . ''
the system is to be piloted in torbay .
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: hamon joins gloucester city on loan
text: exeter city 's guernsey-born goalkeeper james hamon has joined national league south side gloucester city on a 93-day loan .
the 22-year-old , who has played nearly 30 games for the grecians , has made just three starts for exeter this season in the checkatrade trophy .
having trained with gloucester on thursday he will go straight into their squad for their match with weston-super-mare on saturday .
his departure comes after exeter brought in paul jones on loan from norwich city on thursday .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: coastpath closed after cliff fall
text: people are being urged to keep away from the coastpath between porthleven and loe bar on the south coast of cornwall after a cliff fall .
the national trust says there are large waves in that area , and has issued a safety warning .
it has closed the path , but asks people to avoid the area .
caution : we have had to close the cliff path between porthleven and loe bar today due to a large cliff fall .
please avoid this area , the waves are still very large and causing ongoing damage .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: exeter have 'nothing to lose ' against west brom
text: exeter city boss paul tisdale says his side have `` nothing to lose '' when they face premier league club west bromwich albion in the third round of the fa cup on saturday .
west brom are without a win in their last 21 matches and are bottom of the premier league , while city are seventh in league two , two points off the automatic promotion places .
`` we 're playing a premier league team at home in the fa cup with nothing to lose and we 're going to really enjoy the day , '' tisdale told bbc sport .

`` whatever they 've done over the last few games is probably irrelevant , they 're a premier league team with professional people who want to do their best , so i think we 're looking forward to it and we realise it 's going to be a very tough game .
`` we have got one or two players out injured , which makes life a little bit difficult , so for whatever west brom do , we 've also got one or two of our own issues . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: car crash blocks two lanes in exeter
text: topsham rd approach to countess wear rbt .
collision with car blocking two lanes nr esso garage .
police aware .
temp lights topsham rd/glasshouse lane causing delays western power aware , will manually control and hope to finish works by 1230hrs hg
topsham road so so so busy all roadworks should be night time only but be prepared for more congestion if plans to build on land off southbrook road approved at appeal

documents.title: ted the seal broke jaw on rocks
text: a seal has been found with a fractured jaw after being washed up on rocks by storm eleanor .
the animal was found by rescuers at gwithian in cornwall .
the seal , called ted , is now recovering at the cornish seal sanctuary with other victims of winter storms .
british divers marine life rescue said the number of animals rescued was `` unprecedented '' .
spokesman dan jarvis said many were pups born in october .
`` they are trying to hunt for themselves , but they are not brilliantly successful at hunting , '' he said .
`` we are seeing a lot of underweight animals . ''
he advised anyone who sees washed up seals to leave them alone .
`` they come on to land to rest and after a prolonged period of stress they are going to be exhausted .
`` so do not shoo them into the water , they are tired and they need to sleep and rest . ''
many animals have been rescued from beaches in devon and cornwall after stormy weather battered the counties .
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: man charged for dangerous dog offences
text: a man has been charged following an alleged incident involving out of control dogs in exeter on saturday 23 december .

devon and cornwall police say a 26-year-old man has been charged with being the owner of a dog dangerously out of control , causing unnecessary suffering to an animal , and being drunk and disorderly in a public place .
he is due to appear at exeter magistrates court at the end of january .

documents.title: strong argyle squad for bury encounter
text: plymouth argyle 's only outfield injury concern is aaron taylor-sinclair ahead of saturday 's league one game with bottom side bury .

argyle are still without their three injured goalkeepers luke mccormick , kyle letheren and robbert te loeke , so remi matthews will start in goal after finalising his loan move from norwich city until the end of the season .

but adams , whose side have moved out of the relegation places after an excellent run of six games unbeaten in the league , says his side must be wary of a bury team who have brought in a number of new players .
`` bury have enhanced their squad over the last 24 hours , taking in a central defender and a striker , and they might change things around .
`` they 've got a big squad , they might look to shuffle about , '' he added to bbc radio devon .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: salvagers warned off devon 's beaches
text: councils in north devon are asking people not to head for beaches after learning that tonnes of timber planks are expected to wash ashore .
north devon council and torridge district council are urging people to keep away and not to put themselves at risk trying to salvage the wood .
the maritime and coastguard agency ( mca ) says eight tonnes of timber fell off the deck of the lady ariane during storm eleanor on wednesday morning .
some pieces have already washed ashore at westward ho !
with more expected over the next couple of days .

documents.title: driver charged after a30 accident
text: a 53-year-old man from the liskeard area has been charged with two counts of causing serious injury by dangerous driving after an accident near bolventor on the a30 on wednesday evening .
the man is expected to appear at bodmin magistrates court this morning .

documents.title: jones eyes promotion with exeter
text: jones eyes promotion with exeter
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: timber spill heading for devon beaches
text: eight tonnes of timber that fell off a cargo vessel earlier this week , is thought to be heading for beaches in north devon .
the maritime and coastguard agency says some pieces have already washed up at westward ho ! .
it has come from the vessel lady ariane who lost some of her deck cargo during poor weather conditions in the early hours of wednesday .

documents.title: no further damage to storm-hit sea wall
text: the sea wall in portreath that had a 65ft ( 20m ) hole blasted into it by storm eleanor , has not been damaged further by this morning 's high tide .
repair work is expected to begin today .
first light at # portreath and thankfully high tide as passed without event .
hopefully that 's the last of the big tides and the repairs can begin soon .
# floodaware # stormeleanor @ twitterid

documents.title: washed-up seals 'overwhelm ' rescuers after storms
text: animal rescuers say they are `` overwhelmed '' by the number of washed up seals in the wake of winter storms .
many animals have been rescued from beaches in devon and cornwall after stormy weather battered the counties .
the latest , storm eleanor , which brought winds of 100mph ( 161kmph ) and huge swell , combined with spring tides to destroy sea defences .
volunteers from british divers marine life rescue ( bdmlr ) said they had received five to 10 calls a day for the last two weeks - compared to eight to 12 usually .
many of those rescued are pups were born at the end of last year .
dan jarvis of bdmlr said : `` we have been overwhelmed with calls .
`` there are a lot of exhausted animals out there . ''
author: Jonathan Morris
BBC News Online

documents.title: work due to start repairing storm-hit sea wall
text: engineers are starting work to temporarily repair the damaged sea wall at portreath today .
on wednesday morning , storm eleanor blasted a 65ft ( 20m ) hole in the harbour wall , just metres from several houses .
there had been fears the properties would flood during subsequent high tides - but this was not the case .
cormac will carry out temporary repairs to the end of the sea wall , stabilise the concrete ramp and place concrete cubes in various locations to help protect nearby properties from tidal flooding .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: gulls line-up dependent on new faces
text: torquay united manager gary owers says his line-up for saturday 's trip to wrexham in the national league will depend on how many new players he can bring to the bottom-of-the-table club .

the gulls have already bolstered their ranks with the loan signings of colchester united midfielder tommy o'sullivan and plymouth argyle striker alex fletcher , while michee efete has extended his loan until the end of the season .
owers , who will be missing centre-back josh gowling and forward ryan higgins , is still hopeful of getting a second forward in time for the trip to the racecourse ground .
`` at the moment i do n't know what the team 's going to be as i do n't know who will be here and who may have left , '' owers told bbc sport .
`` wrexham have been almost watertight defensively , but then all of a sudden in the last game conceded three .

`` everyone thinks they can beat us because of our position in the league , so we have to go and deal with all of that and find a bit of spirit and try and come back with something for our efforts . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: work to repair historic footbridge
text: a £ 145,000 project to replace an iconic wooden bridge over a busy cornish road started this week .
the current bridge at trelissick gardens , near truro , is 30 years old and beyond repair .
it will be removed in three sections and then replaced by a new oak structure .
the work will involve closing the road to the king harry ferry over several nights between now and mid february .
work is underway to remove and replace the old wooden footbridge @ twitterid - some work will be carried out at night to avoid disruption to the king harry ferry @ twitterid @ twitterid
i was there the day the old bridge was put in place about 20 years ago .
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: truro aim to extend winning run to three games
text: truro city goalkeeper tom mchale says the club are aiming to extend their winning start to 2018 .
the white tigers travel to bath city after back-to-back festive period wins over poole town in national league south .
truro are currently fourth in the table and have not lost a game for a month .
`` we 're going to go up there this weekend full of confidence , '' mchale told bbc radio cornwall
`` we 've up six points from our last two games , we want to make it nine this weekend .

`` i do n't think bath are going to let us go up there and get in their faces and play , but we 're going to do all we can to put them on the back foot early like we have done to a lot of teams this season . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: 'quick and sharp ' flooding in plymouth
text: fire crews were called out to several reports of flooding in plymouth last night .
the flooding was described by devon and somerset fire and rescue as `` quick and sharp '' , and was caused by blocked drains , and flooding within properties due to high tides and heavy rainfall .
the roads affected at about 19:30 included quay road , connaught avenue , beaumont road , shipping quay road , greenbank road and laira bridge road .
# fire crews in the # plymouth area are currently dealing with a large amount of # flooding incidents , due to blocked drains and heavy rainfall .
please take care when driving in this weather .

documents.title: gala bingo closed after 'waterfall ' pours through ceiling
text: a bingo hall has been forced to shut its doors after torrential downpours turned areas of the building into a `` waterfall '' .
author: Plymouth Herald

documents.title: exeter injury doubts ahead of big fa cup tie
text: exeter manager paul tisdale will make a late call on top-scorer jayden stockley for their clash with premier league west bromwich albion on saturday .
the forward broke his nose in monday 's loss at newport county , while he also faces injury problems at centre back .
captain jordan moore-taylor is a doubt with a muscle injury while fellow defenders troy brown and luke croll are out .

bottom-of-the-table west brom have not won any of their last 20 games and are the first top-flight team to play at st james park since city held liverpool to a 2-2 draw at the same stage of the fa cup two years ago .
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: 'irresponsible ' parent shares image of children in waves
text: an `` irresponsible and thoughtless '' parent has prompted hundreds of angry comments after posting a of his children among waves in cornwall .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: warning over 'sand cliffs ' on beaches
text: people are being urged to take care around 'sand cliffs ' that have developed on several cornish beaches following the recent stormy weather .
the beaches include perranporth , crantock and summerleaze in bude .
the rnli said the sand cliffs `` contain huge quantities of heavy sand and are extremely unstable .
`` children and dogs are especially at risk as they may not see the steep drop when approaching from the top and anyone should be discouraged from digging into them . ''
# stormeleanor has left steep sand cliffs at # crantock - @ twitterid + @ twitterid are warning people to take care on `` extremely unstable '' dunes
take care of your dogs too !
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online

documents.title: cornwall travel : traffic problems in truro
text: cornwall travel : traffic problems in truro
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: exeter 's england duo set to miss newcastle trip
text: exeter 's england duo jack nowell and harry williams are set to miss saturday 's trip to newcastle in the premiership .
the pair were both forced to withdraw from this week 's england training camp - winger nowell has an ankle injury and prop williams has a head injury .
`` we 're assessing his ankle day by day , '' director of rugby rob baxter told bbc sport .

`` it does n't look at this stage a particularly bad one , whether it will be too quick with it also being a rubber crumb surface which we tend to be very careful on with jack as well , i can easily see him not being involved . ''
author: Brent Pilnick
BBC Sport

documents.title: historic pub on bodmin moor to close
text: a village pub in cornwall which has been serving beer for almost 200 years will shut and converted into two homes - despite a campaign to save it .
author: Cornwall Live

documents.title: protest over free school bus
text: a school bus protest walk is planned in south east cornwall later .
cornwall council provides a free school bus for children from hatt who attend landulph primary school up to the age of eight .
after that parents would have to pay £ 100 a term for their child to use the bus as the walking route is under three miles and deemed to be safe .
some parents are n't happy and say the route is not safe , and want the council to rethink .
author: Tamsin Melville
Political Reporter, BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: four 'very nice ' cars damaged by fallen tree
text: a fallen tree has smashed into a house , garage and four `` very nice cars '' near ashburton say police .

documents.title: national trust assessing storm damage
text: the national trust says it has teams `` assessing any damage '' to its properties , estates and coastal areas following storm eleanor .
it has already started to repair a wooden bridge at trelissick house near truro that has been in need of replacing for some time .
it hopes the new oak bridge will be in use by 20 february .

a spokesperson said : `` in any poor weather conditions we would ask visitors to our places to take great care and not put themselves at risk , and of course keep an eye out on social media both regionally and very locally for updates . ''
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: council house tenant living with damp for 14 years
text: a council house tenant with lung disease and asthma says her health is getting worse due to damp problems caused by a roof which has been leaking on and off for the past 14 years .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: cornwall travel : slow moving at carkeel and temple
text: cornwall travel : slow moving at carkeel and temple
author: BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: devon travel : lane blocked in exeter
text: devon travel : lane blocked in exeter
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: major road closed as car overturns
text: police sealed off one of the routes into exeter city centre after a car crashed and overturned .
author: Devon Live

documents.title: weather : heavy , thundery showers possible
text: there will be some sunny periods , but also some occasionally heavy showers , which may be thundery with hail also possible .
winds will gradually ease during the day .
maximum temperature : 9c ( 48f ) .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: storm eleanor changes shape of beaches
text: storm eleanor changes shape of beaches
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC Radio Cornwall

documents.title: huge gap in undiagnosed dementia patients
text: it 's thought four in 10 older people with dementia in the south west are undiagnosed .
nhs figures show almost 30,000 over 65s are registered with the condition , but it 's thought the true figure is about 50,000 .
due to the high numbers , those referred by their doctor for diagnosis can face a long wait - and nhs figures show half of those referred to memory clinics turn out not to have dementia .
a programme to help gps decide who best to refer is to be piloted in torbay next year .

experts at the university of exeter have designed an computer programme which they hope will reassure those without the disease and allow fast diagnosis and subsequently support for those who have dementia .
author: Jenny Walrond
Health Correspondent, BBC Spotlight

documents.title: farmers urge ministers to back nature-friendly agriculture
text: a farmer from devon is joining more than 100 others to call on the government to support nature friendly farming .
jon andrews runs a 300 acre livestock and arable farm in south devon near wembury .
he wants a post-brexit farming plan to help protect british wildlife , and to encourage farmers to grow affordable and healthy food .
on thursday , plans for the way farming subsidies will be dealt with after brexit were set out by michael gove .
farmers will receive payments for `` public goods '' , such as access to the countryside and planting meadows .
author: BBC Radio Devon

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live for devon and cornwall
text: welcome tolocal live in devon & cornwall , we 'll be bringing you all the day 's news , sport , weather and travel and if you have a story email us .
author: Johnny O'Shea
BBC News Online
